Grace Hopper

Computing Pioneer. Navy Rear Admiral. Grace Hopper wasn't one for barriers.

Here's a time line of Grace Hopper's life:

  • 1906 - Born in New York City
  • 1924 - Grace went to Graham High School
  • 1930 - She receives her bachelors degree in mathematics and physics
  • 1931 - Grace gets arried to Vincent Foster Hopper
  • 1943 - Grace joins W.A.V.E.S, a naval branch reserve
  • 1952 - Grace develops the first computer compiler called the A-0 system
  • 1969 - Grace is the first person named computer science Man of The Year by the data processing management association
  • 1973 - Grace became the only woman and only american to be a distinguished member of the British Computer Society
  • 1983 - Grace's work was recognized by her promotion to the rank of Commodore
  • 1985 - At the age of seventy-nine she became a Rear Admiral
  • 1992 - At eighty-five years old, she suffered a heart attack in her sleep and passed away. She was buried in Arlington National Cemetery

"A ship in port is safe, but that's not what ships are built for."

--- Grace Hopper

If you have time, you should read more about this incredible human being on her wikipedia entry
